sub_topic: Identifying the Lewis structure of a molecule
message_1: What is the Lewis structure of the methane (CH4) molecule, and how many covalent bonds are formed between each carbon and hydrogen atom?
message_2:
The Lewis structure of the methane (CH4) molecule consists of a central carbon atom surrounded by four hydrogen atoms. Each hydrogen atom shares a single electron with the carbon atom, forming a single covalent bond. In total, there are four single covalent bonds formed between the carbon and hydrogen atoms in the methane molecule.

The Lewis structure can be represented as:

       H
       |
    H--C--H
       |
       H
